required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Two Behavioral Sleep Interventions Among College Students (ProjectTECH)
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison Trial of Two Behavioral Sleep Interventions to Improve Sleep-related Outcomes and Reduce Technology Usage Among College Students

brief_summary.textblock: The study was a randomized controlled trial designed to examine whether augmenting traditional sleep hygiene and stimulus control procedures with technology use reduction stimulus control procedures would produce better sleep and technology usage outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty college students were randomized to a 4-week sleep hygiene and stimulus control intervention (ACI) or an enhanced intervention including technology stimulus control instructions (TI).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to posttest, approximately 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Scores on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to posttest, approximately 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported usage of various forms of technology in minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to posttest, approximately 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Scores on the Sleep Hygiene Practice Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to posttest, approximately 5 weeks

arm_group.description: Participants were provided with sleep hygiene and stimulus control procedures.
Participants were given the same intervention materials as the active control condition plus procedures to change technology use.

intervention.description: Participants were provided with sleep hygiene and stimulus control procedure plus procedures to reduce technology usage in bed (i.e., technology usage stimulus control). In addition to the sleep hygiene and stimulus control procedures, participants were also given a set of procedures aimed at changing technology usage behavior at bedtime and throughout the day.
Participants were provided with sleep hygiene and stimulus control procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must be at least 18 years old, enrolled at Oakland University, and reside in an on-campus dormitory to participate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
